id.description: ID of the background process instance

user.description: ID of the user who started the process

created.description: Time that the process was created in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format

started.description: Time that the process was started in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. 'null' if the process has not yet started.

ended.description: Time that the process ended in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. 'null' if the process is still active.

numberOfWarnings.description: Number of warnings during process execution

numberOfErrors.description: Number of errors during process execution

BackgroundProcessIdentification.description: Object wrapping a background process ID

id.description: ID of the background process type
ID of the background process attachment

name.description: Name of the background process attachment

mimeType.description: Mime type of the background process attachment

originalAttachmentId.description: Original ID of the background process attachment. Please remember that this ID does not have to be unique - same ID can be used by multiple attachments if the attachment holds multiple files

description.description: Description of the background process attachment

values.description: Classification values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

references.description: References / links from the classification. Keys are reference / link type IDs and values either a SingleReference or a MultiReference depending on whether the reference type is multivalued.

Condition.description: An "abstract" representation of a condition. Must always either be an AndCondition, an OrCondition, an IdCondition, a NameCondition, a TextValueCondition, a NumericValueCondition, an ObjectTypeCondition, a SimpleBelowCondition, an LovValueCondition, a HasReferenceToCondition or a HasDataContainerObjectCondition.

DataContainer.description: An "abstract" representation of a data container. Will always either be a SingleDataContainer or a MultiDataContainer depending on whether the data container type is multivalued.

DataContainerEntry.description: An atomic data container a.k.a. a data container object

values.description: Data container values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

references.description: References from the data container. Keys are reference type IDs and values either a SingleReference or a MultiReference depending on whether the reference type is multivalued.

DataContainerObjectCondition.description: An "abstract" representation of a condition that can be used to match data container objects. Must always either be an AndCondition, an OrCondition, a TextValueCondition, a NumericValueCondition, or an LovValueCondition. Notice that conditions nested in compound conditions must also be valid data container object conditions.

id.description: ID of the data container type object

multivalued.description: Boolean indication of whether the data container type allows for multiple data container entries / objects

values.description: Data container type metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

DataTypeGroup.description: A data type group (a.k.a. "attribute group") object

id.description: ID of the data type group object

parent.description: ID of parent data type group

values.description: Data type group metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

enabledOn.description: Time that the endpoint was enabled in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null for disabled endpoints.

lastRun.description: Time for last run (invocation) in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null if the endpoint has never run.

nextRun.description: Time for next run (invocation) in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null if no next run is scheduled.

numberOfCreatedWorkerProcesses.description: The number of worker processes that have been created for this endpoint

avgWorkerProcessProcessingTimeInSeconds.description: Average worker process processing time in seconds. Will be null if no processes have run or if the information is not available.

maxWorkerProcessProcessingTimeInSeconds.description: Maximum worker process processing time in seconds. Will be null if no processes have run or if the information is not available.

values.description: Entity values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

references.description: References from the entity. Keys are reference type IDs and values either a SingleReference or a MultiReference depending on whether the reference type is multivalued.

dataContainers.description: Entity data containers. Keys are data container type IDs and values either a SingleDataContainer or a MultiDataContainer depending on whether the data container type is multivalued.

message.description: Extended error information. Notice that error messages may change without warning and that programming logic should not rely upon the content of the message.

httpReason.description: The name of the HTTP status code

enabledOn.description: Time that the event processor was enabled in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null for disabled event processors.

lastRun.description: Time for last run (invocation) in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null if the event processor has never run.

nextRun.description: Time for next run (invocation) in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Will be null if no next run is scheduled.

EventQueueStatus.description: Status of an event queue. I.e. whether it is enabled (listening) or not.

enabled.description: Is the queue enabled (listening) or not

entryType.description: The type of entry. Either 'info', 'warning' or 'error'.

ExportSpecification.description: Object holding optional data for starting an export process

stepUrls.description: STEP URLs for the nodes to be used as the roots for the export. If 'stepUrls' is 'null' or an empty array is supplied, root nodes from the export configuration will be used.

processDescription.description: Desired process description. If not supplied, an auto generated description will be used.

FindSimilarBusinessRuleResult.description: Object holding additional information about business rule that rejects the incoming entity as source for find similar

dataIssuesReport.description: Optional detailed messages about data issues

FindSimilarEntitiesRequest.description: Object holding the data for a Find Similar operation for entities

maxResults.description: Optional specification for maximum number of similar entities to return. Defaults to 10 and can not exceed 1000.

FindSimilarEntitiesResponse.description: Object holding the result of a Find Similar operation

FindSimilarEntitiesResponseRecord.description: Object holding an entity and its rank score with the entity in the request

rank.description: Rank score against entity in the request as calculated by the Matching Algorithm.

entity.description: Existing Entity found by Find Similar

FindSimilarExecutionReport.description: Object holding additional information about the result of the find similar operation

httpReason.description: The name of the HTTP status code

message.description: Extended error information that can be shown to users.

rejectedByBusinessRuleID.description: ID of first failing or rejecting business rule

businessRuleRejections.description: Detailed information from all rejecting business rules

HasDataContainerObjectCondition.description: Condition type for matching objects that have data container objects with specific properties

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "hasdatacontainerobject" for this type of condition.

matchInheritedDataContainerObjects.description: Should the query match hierarchically inherited data container objects

HasReferenceToCondition.description: Has reference query condition. Matches objects that have cross references to the specified target object. This condition type cannot be used to match objects by classification product links.

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "hasreferenceto" for this type of condition.

target.description: The target node ID. Super type will be deduced from the reference type.

matchInheritedReferences.description: Should the query match hierarchically inherited cross references

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "id" for this type of condition.

queryString.description: The query string. When the "like" operator is used, the wildcards "*" (any number of characters) and "?" (single character) can be used in the query string. Wildcard characters can be escaped using "\". I.e. like("\\?*") will match values starting with a question mark. Notice that backslash character ("\") needs to be escaped if searching for that character. Notice that queries starting with a wildcard typically will not perform well.

id.description: ID of the inbound integration endpoint

name.description: Name of the inbound integration endpoint

id.description: ID of the gateway integration endpoint

name.description: Name of the gateway integration endpoint

IncomingReferenceEntry.description: An atomic reference seen from the reference target. Can represent both a "cross reference" and a "classifictaion product link".

values.description: Reference metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

ListOfValues.description: A list of values object. Notice that the representation does not include value entires. These must be obtained via a separate resource.

id.description: ID of the list of values object

extendable.description: Boolean indication of whether it is possible to add values to the list of values via data objects

usesValueIds.description: Boolean indication of whether the list of values uses value IDs

values.description: List of values metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

ListOfValuesEntry.description: A value entry for a list of values

valueId.description: The value ID (for lists of values that use value IDs)

LovValueCondition.description: LOV value query condition. This type of value condition can be used for LOV validated attributes for which the LOV uses value IDs.

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "lovvalue" for this type of condition.

attribute.description: Id of the attribute for which to match the value

matchInheritedValues.description: Should the query match hierarchically inherited values

MatchAndMergeGeneralExecutionReport.description: Object holding additional information about the result of the match and merge operation

httpReason.description: The name of the HTTP status code

message.description: Extended error information that can be shown to users

MatchAndMergeExecutionReport.description: Execution report for a single Record in a Match and Merge Request

operation.description: The operation performed for the Merge Golden Record in the response"

rejectedByPotentialDuplicates.description: Indicates that the record was rejected by potential duplicates

rejectedByBusinessConditionID.description: ID of business condition that rejected the Record

rejectedByBusinessConditionReason.description: Message from the business condition that rejected the record

MatchAndMergePotentialDuplicate.description: A potential duplicate in a Match and Merge request

MatchAndMergeResponse.description: Object holding the result of a Match And Merge operation.

matchAndMergeResponses.description: List of individual Record result from a Match and Merge Request, correlated by correlation ID to a MatchAndMergeRecordIn

MatchAndMergeRecordIn.description: A Match an Merge Entity with correlation ID

correlationID.description: Correlation ID of the Match and Merge entity object

MatchAndMergeRecordOut.description: Individual Record result from a Match and Merge Request, correlated by correlation ID to a MatchAndMergeRecordIn

correlationID.description: Correlation ID as posted in the request

potentialDuplicates.description: Potential duplicates for the input record.

MultiDataContainer.description: Data containers for a multivalued data container type

inherited.description: Indicates whether the datacontainer is inherited from parent node.

MultiReference.description: References for a multivalued reference type. Covers both "cross references" and "classification product links".

references.description: Multiple references of specific reference type

MultiValue.description: A value for a multivalued attribute

contextLocal.description: Indicates whether the value is set locally or inherited from a dimension point / a combination dimension points different from the ones used for current context. Should not be supplied for value updates. If supplied with the value "false", the update of the specific value will be skipped.

inherited.description: Indicates whether the value is inherited from parent node.

values.description: Multiple values entries for multivalued attribute

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "name" for this type of condition.

queryString.description: The query string. When the "like" operator is used, the wildcards "*" (any number of characters) and "?" (single character) can be used in the query string. Wildcard characters can be escaped using "\". I.e. like("\\?*") will match values starting with a question mark. Notice that backslash character ("\") needs to be escaped if searching for that character. Notice that queries starting with a wildcard typically will not perform well.

ignoreCase.description: Should the query be non-case sensitive

NumericValueCondition.description: Numeric value query condition. This type of value condition can only be used for attributes of the validation base types "Integer", "Number", and "Fraction". If no unit information is supplied, the condition will only match values without units. E.g. "5" is not equal to "5 kg".

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "numericvalue" for this type of condition.

attribute.description: ID of the attribute for which to match the value. Attribute validation base type must be either "Integer", "Number", "Fraction" or "Numeric Text".

unit.description: ID of the unit that "queryValue" is supplied in

matchInheritedValues.description: Should the query match hierarchically inherited values

id.description: ID of the object type object

values.description: Object type metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "objecttype" for this type of condition.

OrCondition.description: Compound condition that lets you "OR" multiple other conditions

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "or" for this type of condition.

id.description: ID of the outbound integration endpoint

name.description: Name of the outbound integration endpoint

values.description: Product values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

references.description: References / links from the product. Keys are reference / link type IDs and values either a SingleReference or a MultiReference depending on whether the reference type is multivalued.

dataContainers.description: Product data containers. Keys are data container type IDs and values either a SingleDataContainer or a MultiDataContainer depending on whether the data container type is multivalued.

Query.description: A query specification. Nested condition can be a compound condition. See "Condition" for more information.

QueryResult.description: A query result. The "type" and "id" combined uniquely identifies an object in STEP.

Reference.description: An "abstract" representation of references for a specific reference type. Will always either be a SingleReference or a MultiReference depending on whether the reference type is multivalued.

ReferenceEntry.description: An atomic reference. Can represent both a "cross reference" and a "classification product link".

contextLocal.description: Indicates whether the reference is set locally or inherited from a dimension point / a combination dimension points different from the ones used for current context. Should not be supplied for reference updates. If supplied with the value "false", the update will be skipped.

inherited.description: Indicates whether the reference entry is inherited from parent node.

values.description: Reference metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

entity.description: The encapsulating reference should point to the specified entity. Only supported by find-similar and match-and-merge and the targetType of the reference must be entity. The embedded entity should be denoted by source information, i.e. it should have a source relation where source system id and source record id is known to originator of the JSON request. The supplied source information will be used for looking up actual target record of the encapsulating relation. Cannot be applied together with target id.

ReferenceMetadataCondition.description: An "abstract" representation of a condition that can be used to match reference metadata. Must always either be an AndCondition, an OrCondition, a TextValueCondition, a NumericValueCondition, or an LovValueCondition. Notice that conditions nested in compound conditions must also be valid reference metadata conditions.

ReferenceType.description: A reference type object. Can represent both "cross reference types" and "classification product link types".

id.description: ID of the reference type object

productClassificationLinkType.description: Boolean indication of whether the type is a "classification product link type" as opposed to a "cross reference type"

multivalued.description: Boolean indication of whether multiple references / links from a single source are allowed. Notice that a "classification product link type" always will be multivalued when seen from the classification side.

validSourceObjectTypes.description: IDs of the valid source object types

validTargetObjectTypes.description: IDs of the valid target object types

values.description: Reference type metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "simplebelow" for this type of condition.

topNodeId.description: ID of the node to match results below

topNodeType.description: Type of node to match results below

SingleDataContainer.description: A data container for a single-valued data container type

inherited.description: Indicates whether the datacontainer is inherited from parent node.

SingleReference.description: A reference for a single-valued reference type. Covers both "cross references" and "classification product links".

SingleValue.description: A value for a single-valued attribute

calculated.description: Indicates whether the value is calculated. Should not be supplied for value updates. If supplied with the value "true", the update of the specific value will be skipped.

contextLocal.description: Indicates whether the value is set locally or inherited from a dimension point / a combination dimension points different from the ones used for current context. Should not be supplied for value updates. If supplied with the value "false", the update of the specific value will be skipped.

inherited.description: Indicates whether the value is inherited from parent node.

User.description: A user of the STEP system. A user can be part of several Groups and will inherit privileges from these Groups so that the privileges of a User becomes the super set of privileges inherited from the Groups that have the User as a member.

values.description: User values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

userGroups.description: IDs of groups having this user as a member

UserGroup.description: Group of users with certain privileges

parentId.description: ID of the parent user group of this user group

vendorRoot.description: Vendor classification associated with this user group. Updating user group with empty "vendorRoot" value removes existing vendor classification assignment.

values.description: User group values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

UserGroupChangeRequest.description: Message body used for adding and removing user from the user group

WorkflowInstanceCreation.description: Message body used for starting a workflow / creating an instance

message.description: The message to submit while starting the workflow

TextValueCondition.description: Text value query condition. This type of value condition can be used for all types of attributes.

conditionType.description: The condition type. Must have the value "textvalue" for this type of condition.

attribute.description: Id of the attribute for which to match the value

queryString.description: The query string. When the "like" operator is used, the wildcards "*" (any number of characters) and "?" (single character) can be used in the query string. Wildcard characters can be escaped using "\". I.e. like("\\?*") will match values starting with a question mark. Notice that backslash character ("\") needs to be escaped if searching for that character. Notice that queries starting with a wildcard typically will not perform well.

matchInheritedValues.description: Should the query match hierarchically inherited values

ignoreCase.description: Should the query be non-case sensitive

TriggerWorkflowEvent.description: Message body used for triggering a workflow event

message.description: The message to submit while triggering the event

values.description: Unit metadata values. Keys are attribute IDs and values either a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

Value.description: An "abstract" representation of a value. Will always either be a SingleValue or a MultiValue depending on whether the attribute is multivalued.

ValueEntry.description: An atomic value. A value will consist of either a "value" alone, a "valueId" alone, a "value" and a "unit" or a "value", a "valueId" and a "unit". For writes, "valueId" takes precedence over "value" (and implicitly "unit") that will be ignored if "valueId" is supplied.

valueId.description: Value ID to be used with list of values based attributes for which the list of values uses value IDs

validObjectTypes.description: IDs of the object types for which this workflow is valid

id.description: The event ID. Must/will be populated if 'anonymous' is 'false'.

anonymous.description: Indicates whether the event is anonymous. If 'false', an 'id' must/will be present. If 'true', a provided 'id' will be ignored.

WorkflowInstance.description: Basic representation of a workflow instance

WorkflowNode.description: A node for which a workflow instance can exist

workflow.description: ID of the workflow to which this task belongs

state.description: ID of the workflow state for this task

userAssignee.description: ID of the user to which this task is assigned. Will be null if task is assigned to a user group in which case 'groupAssignee' will be populated.

groupAssignee.description: ID of the user group to which this task is assigned. Will be null if task is assigned to a user in which case 'userAssignee' will be populated.

deadline.description: Deadline for this task in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format. Null if no deadline.

taskCreationTime.description: Time that the task was created in yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss&#177hh:mm format

WorkflowTaskQuery.description: A workflow task query specification. All properties are optional query filters. If no values are supplied, the query will match all tasks assigned to the user executing the query and tasks assigned to groups that the user is a member of.

workflow.description: Optional workflow filter. Can be populated with workflow ID.

state.description: Optional state filter. Can be populated with state ID.

statusFlag.description: Optional status flag filter. Can be populated with status flag ID.

directAssignment.description: If 'true', the query will match only tasks assigned directly to the user invoking the operation. If 'false', the query will match both tasks assigned directly to the user and tasks assigned to a group that the user is a member of.

includeNonLeafTasks.description: If 'true', the query will match tasks for 'parallels' and 'clusters' in addition to 'leaf tasks'
